full_description: use a arm to open the cabinet's drawer, and use another arm to put the object on the table to the drawer.
schema: {A} notifies the object, {B} notifies the cabinet (use 'the drawer of {B}' or '{B}'s drawer'), {a} notifies the arm to open the drawer. Another arm to put the object into the drawer use literal 'the other arm'
preference: num of words should not exceed 20. Degree of detail avg is 8.If {a} is mentioned in one description, 'the other arm' or 'another arm' must be mentioned in another description.Or otherwise both arm should not be mentioned. BUT {A} and {B} should always be mentioned in each description

template_example.visual_state_description: I can see a mouse on the right part of table and a cabinet with several drawers behind. The drawer is closed now.
template_example.reasoning_and_reflection: It may be the beginning of the task. The assistant info provides the placing point. I will move the arm according to this position. The tea-box is on the right. I will use right arm to grasp tea-box and use left arm to open the drawer.
template_example.language_plan: I will use the nearest arm to grab the mouse first. And then use another arm to grasp the handle of bottom drawer. After that, I will move arm to open the drawer and move another arm to place the mouse. According to observation and position data, I will lift object, move it left and forward. So I need increase z and y, and then decrease x by MOVE_BY_DISPLACEMENT() function.

parameters.y: ...(SOME FLOAT VALUE THROUGH YOUR OBSERVATION AND THINKING)...
